definitions.definition: The topographical boundary dividing two adjacent catchment basins , such as a ridge or a crest .
definitions.label_groups: hydrology , UK , Ireland , Australia , New Zealand

definitions.definition: A region of land within which water flows down into a specified body, such as a river, lake, sea, or ocean; a drainage basin .
A critical point marking a change in course or development.

The time during the day which material of a more adult nature (e.g., violence , swear words , or sex ) may be broadcast on television or radio , either one permitted by law or one contrived from convention (e.g. when children are not watching ).

main_definition: ( hydrology , UK , Ireland , Australia , New Zealand ) The topographical boundary dividing two adjacent catchment basins , such as a ridge or a crest .
secondary_definitions: ( hydrology , US , Canada ) A region of land within which water flows down into a specified body, such as a river, lake, sea, or ocean; a drainage basin .
( figurative ) A critical point marking a change in course or development.

( Canada , British , television , radio ) The time during the day which material of a more adult nature (e.g., violence , swear words , or sex ) may be broadcast on television or radio , either one permitted by law or one contrived from convention (e.g. when children are not watching ).
